page.title: 09Wildlife north of Tregony
page.content: In our D-Block there are several environments,including wood, heath, village and the river Fal.In the woods around the area there are rabbits, squirrels, mice, foxes, badgers, stoats and weasels. The number of rabbits has doubled over a year. In contrast there are very few hares.Foxes are few in the area, they are pests to the gamekeepers but the Trewithen gamekeeper keeps two twelve-month old fox cubs as pets! There are three members of the stoat family which cause trouble for farmers.They are the stoat, weasel and mink.The mink went into decline but is now making a comeback.It lives near the river. The lack of small birds is accounted for by a pair of buzzards in the Fal valley.The remaining small birds are finches and warblers.
